column1: The ____ model is the basis for today's computers.

a. Leibnitz
b. von Neumann
c. Pascal
d. Charles Babbage

a. ALU
b. input/output
c. memory
d. control unit

Correct Answer: C

column2:
a. ALU
b. input/output
c. memory
d. control unit

Correct Answer: A

column2:
a. ALU
b. input/output
c. memory
d. control unit

Correct Answer: B

column2:
a. ALU
b. input/output
c. memory
d. control unit

Correct Answer: D

column1: According to the von Neumann model, ____ are stored in memory.
column2:

b. only programs
c. data and programs

d. algorithms

a. Software engineering

A 32-bit code called ____ represents symbols in all languages.

column2:

b. exponent

column2:

b. sign-and-magnitude

column1: 1. ____ is an arithmetic operation.
column2:
a. The exclusive OR
b. The unary NOT
c. Subtraction
d. The binary AND

Correct Answer: C

column2:
a. The exclusive OR
b. The unary NOT
c. The binary AND
d. exclusive OR, unary NOT, or binary AND

Correct Answer: D

column2:
a. sign-and-magnitude
b. one's complement
c. two's complement
d. unsigned integers

column2:
a. add it to the right most column
b. add it to the left most column
c. discard it

column2:

b. -127
c. -128

column2:
a. 8
b. 127

d. 256

a. 8
b. 1

d. -8

column1: 2. An array that consists of just rows and columns is a ____ array.
column2:
a. one-dimensional
b. two-dimensional
c. three-dimensional
d. multidimensional

Correct Answer: B

column1: 3. Each element in a record is called ____.
column2:
a. a variable
b. an index
c. a field
d. a node

Correct Answer: C

column1: 4. All the members of a record must be ____.
column2:
a. the same type
b. related types
c. integer type
d. character type

Correct Answer: B

column1: 5. ____ is an ordered collection of data in which each element contains the location of the next element.
column2:
a. An array
b. A record
c. A linked list
d. A file

Correct Answer: C

column1: 6. In a linked list, each element contains ____.
column2:
a. only data
b. only a link
c. neither data nor a link
d. data and a link

Correct Answer: D

column1: 7. The ____ is a pointer that identifies the next element in the linked list.
column2:
a. link
b. node
c. array
d. data

Correct Answer: A

column1: 8. Given a linked list called children, the pointer variable children identifies ____ element of the linked list.
column2:
a. the first
b. the second
c. the last
d. any

Correct Answer: A

column1: 9. An empty linked list consists of ____.
column2:
a. a node
b. two nodes
c. data and a link
d. a null head pointer

Correct Answer: D

column1: 10. To traverse a list, you need a ____ pointer.
column2:
a. null
b. walking
c. beginning
d. insertion

Correct Answer: B

column1: 1. In an abstract data type, ____.
column2:
a. the ADT implementation is known
b. the ADT implementation is hidden
c. the ADT public operations are hidden
d. Nothing is hidden

Correct Answer: B

column1: 2. A stack is a ____ structure.
column2:
a. FIFO
b. LIFO
c. DIFO
d. SIFO

Correct Answer: B

column1: 3. A(n) ____ list is also known as a queue.
column2:
a. LIFO
b. FIFO
c. unordered
d. ordered

Correct Answer: B

column1: 4. If A is the first data element input into a stack, followed by B, C, and D, then ____ is the first element to be removed.
column2:
a. A
b. B
c. C
d. D

Correct Answer: D

column1: 5. If A is the first data element input into a queue, followed by B, C, and D, then ____ is the first element to be removed.
column2:
a. A
b. B
c. C
d. D

Correct Answer: A

column1: 6. The pop operation ____ of the stack.
column2:
a. deletes an item from the top
b. deletes an item from the bottom
c. inserts an item at the top
d. inserts an item at the bottom

Correct Answer: A

column1: 7. The push operation ____ of the stack.
column2:
a. deletes an item from the top
b. deletes an item from the bottom
c. inserts an item at the top
d. inserts an item at the bottom

Correct Answer: C

column1: 8. In a binary tree, each node has ____ two subtrees.
column2:
a. more than
b. less than
c. at most
d. at least

Correct Answer: C

column1: 9. In preorder traversal of a binary tree, the ____.
column2:
a. left subtree is processed first
b. right subtree is processed first
c. root is processed first
d. the root is never processed

Correct Answer: C

column1: 10. In ____ traversal of a binary tree, the right subtree is processed last.
column2:
a. preorder
b. inorder
c. postorder
d. any order

Correct Answer: B

column1: 12. In postorder traversal of a binary tree, the left subtree is processed ____.
column2:
a. first
b. second
c. last
d. after the right subtree

Correct Answer: A

column1: 14. In an inorder traversal of a binary tree, the root is processed ____.
column2:
a. first
b. second
c. last
d. two times

Correct Answer: B

column1: 15. What is a full binary tree?
column2:
a. Each node has exactly zero or two children
b. Each node has exactly two children
c. All the leaves are at the same level
d. Each node has exactly one or two children

Correct Answer: A

column1: 1. ____ file can be accessed randomly.
column2:
a. A sequential
b. An indexed
c. A hashed
d. Any

Correct Answer: D

column1: 2. ____ file can be accessed sequentially.
column2:
a. A sequential
b. An indexed
c. A hashed
d. No

Correct Answer: A

column1: 3. When a sequential file is updated, the ____ file gets the actual update.
column2:
a. new master
b. old master
c. transaction
d. error report

Correct Answer: A

column1: 4. When a sequential file is updated, the ____ file contains a list of all errors occurring during the update process.
column2:
a. new master
b. old master
c. transaction
d. error report

Correct Answer: D

column1: 5. When a sequential file is updated, the ____ file contains the changes to be applied.
column2:
a. new master
b. old master
c. transaction
d. error report

Correct Answer: C

column1: 6. After a sequential file is updated, the ____ file contains the most current data.
column2:
a. new master
b. old master
c. transaction
d. error report

Correct Answer: A

column1: 7. If the transaction file key is 20 and the first master file key is 25, then we ____.
column2:
a. add the new record to the new master file
b. revise the contents of the old master file
c. delete the data
d. write the old master file record to the new master file

Correct Answer: A

column1: 8. If the transaction file key is 20 with a delete code and the master file key is 20, then we ____.
column2:
a. add the transaction to the new master file
b. revise the contents of the old master file
c. delete the data
d. write the old master file record to the new master file

Correct Answer: C

column1: 9. An indexed file consists of ____.
column2:
a. only a sequential data file
b. only an index
c. only a random data file
d. an index and random data file

Correct Answer: D

column1: 10. The index of an indexed file has ____ fields.
column2:
a. two
b. three
c. four
d. any number of

Correct Answer: A

column1: 11. In the ____ hashing method, selected digits are extracted from the key and used as the address.
column2:
a. direct
b. division remainder
c. modulo division
d. digit extraction

Correct Answer: D

column1: 12. In the ____ hashing method, the key is divided by the file size, and the address is the remainder plus 1.
column2:
a. direct
b. modulo division
c. division remainder
d. digit extraction

Correct Answer: B

column1: 13. In the ____ hashing method, there are no synonyms or collisions.
column2:
a. direct
b. modulo division
c. division remainder
d. digit extraction

Correct Answer: A

column1: 14. ____ are keys that hash to the same location in the data file.
column2:
a. Collisions
b. Buckets
c. Synonyms
d. Linked lists

Correct Answer: C

column1: 15. When a hashing algorithm produces an address for an insertion key and that address is already occupied, it is called a ____.
column2:
a. collision
b. probe
c. synonym
d. linked list

Correct Answer: A

column1: 16. The address produced by a hashing algorithm is the ____ address.
column2:
a. probe
b. synonym
c. collision
d. home

Correct Answer: D

column1: 17. The ____ area is the file area that contains all the home addresses.
column2:
a. probe
b. linked
c. hash
d. prime

Correct Answer: D

column1: 18. In the ____ collision resolution method, we try to put data that cannot be placed in location 123 into location 124.
column2:
a. open addressing
b. linked list
c. bucket hashing
d. random hashing

Correct Answer: A

column1: 19. Which one of the following explains the sequential file access method?
column2:
a. random access according to the given byte number
b. read bytes one at a time, in order
c. read/write sequentially by record
d. read/write randomly by record

Correct Answer: B

column1: 20. The data structure used for file directory is called ____.
column2:
a. mount table
b. hash table
c. file table
d. process table

Correct Answer: B

column1: 1. In a three-level DBMS architecture, the layer that interacts directly with the hardware is the ____ level.
column2:
a. external
b. conceptual
c. internal
d. physical

Correct Answer: C

column1: 2. In a three-level DBMS architecture, the ____ level determines where data is actually stored on the storage devices.
column2:
a. external
b. conceptual
c. internal
d. physical

Correct Answer: C

column1: 3. The ____ level of a three-level DBMS architecture defines the logical view of the data.
column2:
a. external
b. conceptual
c. internal
d. physical

Correct Answer: B

column1: 4. The data model and the schema of a DBMS are often defined at the ____ level.
column2:
a. external
b. conceptual
c. internal
d. physical

Correct Answer: B

column1: 5. In a three-level DBMS architecture, the ____ level interacts directly with the users.
column2:
a. external
b. conceptual
c. internal
d. physical

Correct Answer: A

column1: 6. Of the various database models, the ____ model is the most prevalent today.
column2:
a. hierarchical
b. network
c. relational
d. linked list

Correct Answer: C

column1: 7. Each column in a relation is called ____.
column2:
a. an attribute
b. a tuple
c. a union
d. an attitude

Correct Answer: A

column1: 8. Each row in a relation is called ____.
column2:
a. an attribute
b. a tuple
c. a union
d. an attitude

Correct Answer: B

column1: 9. A unary operator is applied to ____ relation(s) and creates an output of ____ relation(s).
column2:
a. one, one
b. one, two
c. two, one
d. two, two

Correct Answer: A

column1: 10. A binary operator is applied to ____ relations (s) and creates an output of ____ relation(s).
column2:
a. one, one
b. one, two
c. two, one
d. two, two

Correct Answer: C

column1: 11. The unary ____ operation always results in a relation that has exactly one more row than the original relation.
column2:
a. insert
b. delete
c. update
d. select

Correct Answer: A

column1: 12. If you want to change the value of an attribute of a tuple, you use the ____ operation.
column2:
a. project
b. join
c. update
d. select

Correct Answer: C

column1: 13. The operation that takes two relations and combines them based on common attributes is the ____ operation.
column2:
a. join
b. project
c. union
d. intersection

Correct Answer: A

column1: 14. If you need to delete an attribute in a relation, you can use the ____ operation.
column2:
a. join
b. project
c. union
d. intersection

Correct Answer: B

column1: 15. You want to create a relation called New that contains tuples that belong to both relation A and relation B. For this, you can use the ____ operation.
column2:
a. select
b. union
c. project
d. intersection

Correct Answer: D

column1: 16. Which of the following is a unary operator?
column2:
a. intersection
b. union
c. join
d. project

Correct Answer: D

column1: 1. Data is compressed using a dictionary with indexes to strings. This is ____.
column2:
a. Huffman encoding
b. Lempel Ziv encoding
c. Morse coding
d. lossy coding

Correct Answer: B

column1: 2. A string of one hundred 0s is replaced by two markers, a 0, and the number 100. This is ____.
column2:
a. run-length encoding
b. Morse coding
c. Huffman encoding
d. Lempel Ziv encoding

Correct Answer: A

column1: 3. ____ is an example of lossy compression.
column2:
a. Huffman encoding
b. Lempel Ziv encoding
c. Run-length encoding
d. JPEG

Correct Answer: D

column1: 4. In a ____ data compression method, the received data is an exact copy of the original message.
column2:
a. lossless
b. lossy
c. JPEG
d. MPEG

Correct Answer: A

column1: 5. ____ data compression method, the received data need not be an exact copy of the original message.
column2:
a. Only in MP3
b. Only in JPEG
c. Only in MPEG
d. In MP3, JPEG, or MPEG

Correct Answer: D

column1: 6. ____ encoding is a lossless data compression method.
column2:
a. Only Huffman
b. Only Run-length
c. Only LZ
d. Huffman, run-length, or LZ

Correct Answer: D

column1: 7. In ____ encoding, the more frequently occurring characters have shorter codes than the less frequently occurring characters.
column2:
a. Huffman
b. run-length
c. LZ
d. JPEG

Correct Answer: A

column1: 8. In ____ encoding, PPPPPPPPPPPPPPP can be replaced by P15.
column2:
a. Huffman
b. run-length
c. LZ
d. MPEG

Correct Answer: B

column1: 9. LZ encoding requires ____.
column2:
a. only a dictionary
b. only a buffer
c. only an algorithm
d. a dictionary, a buffer, and an algorithm

Correct Answer: D

column1: 10. JPEG encoding involves ____ a process that reveals the redundancies in a block.
column2:
a. blocking
b. the discrete cosine transform
c. quantization
d. vectorization

Correct Answer: B

column1: 11. In JPEG encoding, the ____ process breaks the original picture into smaller blocks and assigns a value to each pixel in a block.
column2:
a. blocking
b. DCT
c. quantization
d. vectorization

Correct Answer: A

column1: 12. The last step in JPEG, ____, removes redundancies.
column2:
a. blocking
b. quantization
c. compression
d. vectorization

Correct Answer: C

column1: 13. ____ is a lossy compression method for pictures and graphics, whereas ____ is a lossy compression method for video.
column2:
a. DCT, MPEG
b. MPEG, JPEG
c. JPEG, MPEG
d. JPEG, DCT

Correct Answer: C

column1: 14. What is compression?
column2:
a. To convert one file to another
b. To reduce the size of data to save space
c. To minimize the time taken for a file to be downloaded
d. To compress something by pressing it very hard

Correct Answer: B

column1: 15. Which of these terms is a type of data compression?
column2:
a. resolution
b. zipping
c. inputting
d. caching

Correct Answer: B

column1: 1. Three security goals are ____.
column2:
a. confidentiality, cryptography, and nonrepudiation
b. confidentiality, encryption, and decryption
c. confidentiality, integrity, and availability
d. confidentiality, denial of service, and masquerading

Correct Answer: C

column1: 2. Which of the following attacks is threatening integrity?
column2:
a. Masquerading
b. Traffic Analysis
c. Denial of service
d. Encoding

Correct Answer: A

column1: 3. Which of the following attacks is threatening availability?
column2:
a. Replaying
b. Modification
c. Denial of service
d. Decoding

Correct Answer: C

column1: 4. ____ means concealing the contents of a message by enciphering.
column2:
a. Steganography
b. Cryptography
c. Compressing
d. Authentication

Correct Answer: B

column1: 5. ____means concealing the message by covering it with something else.
column2:
a. Cryptography
b. Steganography
c. Compressing
d. Authentication

Correct Answer: B

column1: 6. In ____cryptography, the same key is used by the sender and the receiver.
column2:
a. symmetric-key
b. asymmetric-key
c. public-key
d. open-key

Correct Answer: A

column1: 7. In ____ cryptography, the same key is used in both directions.
column2:
a. symmetric-key
b. asymmetric-key
c. public-key
d. open-key

Correct Answer: A

column1: 8. ____ cryptography is often used for long messages.
column2:
a. Symmetric-key
b. Asymmetric-key
c. Public-key
d. Open-key

Correct Answer: A

column1: 9. ____ cryptography is often used for short messages.
column2:
a. Symmetric-key
b. Asymmetric-key
c. Secret-key
d. Open-key

Correct Answer: B

column1: 10. ____ means that the sender and the receiver expect confidentiality.
column2:
a. Nonrepudiation
b. Integrity
c. Authentication
d. encryption and decryption

Correct Answer: D

column1: 11. ____ means that the data must arrive at the receiver exactly as they were sent.
column2:
a. Nonrepudiation
b. Message integrity
c. Authentication
d. Secrecy

Correct Answer: B

column1: 12. ____ can provide authentication, integrity, and nonrepudiation for a message.
column2:
a. Encryption/decryption
b. Digital signature
c. Compression
d. Key-exchange

Correct Answer: B

column1: 13. In ____, the identity of a party is verified once for the entire duration of system access.
column2:
a. entity authentication
b. message integrity
c. message authentication
d. message encryption

Correct Answer: A

column1: 14. In ____ cryptography, everyone has access to everyone's public key.
column2:
a. symmetric-key
b. asymmetric-key
c. secret-key
d. private-key

Correct Answer: B

column1: 15. In the asymmetric-key method used for confidentiality, which key(s) is (are) publicly known?
column2:
a. encryption key only
b. decryption key only
c. both encryption and decryption keys
d. neither encryption key nor decryption key

Correct Answer: B

column1: 1. The ____ statement adds 1 to the variable.
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. complement

Correct Answer: A

column1: 2. The ____ statement repeats one or more actions.
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. complement

Correct Answer: C

column1: 3. The ____ statement subtracts 1 from the variable.
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. complement

Correct Answer: B

column1: 4. To clear a variable, we use the ____ statement(s).
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. decrement and loop

Correct Answer: D

column1: 5. To assign a number to a variable, we use the ____ statement(s).
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. decrement and loop

Correct Answer: A

column1: 6. To copy the value of one variable to another, we use the ____ statement(s).
column2:
a. increment
b. decrement
c. loop
d. increment, decrement, and loop

Correct Answer: D

column1: 7. A Turing machine has these components:
column2:
a. tape, memory, and read/write head
b. disk, controller, and read/write head
c. tape, controller, and read/write head
d. disk, memory, and controller

Correct Answer: C

column1: 8. In a Turing machine, the ____ holds a sequence of characters.
column2:
a. disk
b. tape
c. controller
d. read/write head

Correct Answer: B

column1: 9. The ____ is the theoretical counterpart of the CPU.
column2:
a. disk
b. tape
c. controller
d. read/write head

Correct Answer: C

column1: 10. The controller has ____ states.
column2:
a. three
b. four
c. a finite number of
d. an infinite number of

Correct Answer: C

column1: 11. A ____ is a pictorial representation of the states and their relationships to each other.
column2:
a. transition diagram
b. flowchart
c. transition table
d. Turing machine

Correct Answer: A

column1: 12. A ____ shows, among other things, the movement of the read/write head, the character read, and the character written.
column2:
a. diagram
b. flowchart
c. transition table
d. Turing machine

Correct Answer: C

column1: 13. We use ____ to denote a program's complexity.
column2:
a. the Turing number
b. big-O notation
c. factorials
d. the Simple Language

Correct Answer: B

column1: 14. The complexity of a problem is O (log10 n) and the computer executes 1 million instructions per second. How long does it take to run the program if the number of operations is 10,000?
column2:
a. 1 microsecond
b. 2 microseconds
c. 3 microseconds
d. 4 microseconds

Correct Answer: D

column1: 15. When does the code block following while(x<100) execute?
column2:
a. When x is less than one hundred
b. When x is greater than one hundred
c. When x is equal to one hundred
d. While it wishes

Correct Answer: A

column2:
a. Sir Isaac Newton
b. Gottfried W. Leibniz
c. Alan Turing
d. John McCarthy

Correct Answer: D

column2:
a. Alan Turing
b. John McCarthy

Correct Answer: B

Correct Answer: C

a. Ford is a car.

d. Where is John?

column2:
a. propositional logic

column2:
a. edge detection
b. segmentation
c. stereo vision
d. shading

a. stereo vision

c. texture
d. segmentation

column2:
a. speech recognition

column2:
a. if we have no prior knowledge about the search
b. if we need to do the search quickly

Correct Answer: A

column1: 1. In Facebook, friendship is a ____ relationship.
column2:
a. one-to-one
b. one-to-many
c. many-to-one
d. many-to-many

Correct Answer: A

column1: 2. Communication in Facebook is a ____ relationship.
column2:
a. one-to-one
b. one-to-many
c. many-to-one
d. many-to-many

Correct Answer: B

column1: 3. The home page in Facebook can be used ____.
column2:
a. only for sign-up
b. only for log-in
c. both for sign-up and log-in
d. neither for sign-up nor for log-in

Correct Answer: C

column1: 4. To find friends in Facebook, the member can ____.
column2:
a. can accept Facebook recommendation
b. follow email contacts
c. look for old friends
d. all of the above

Correct Answer: D

column1: 5. When you are in Facebook, you can ____.
column2:
a. post news.
b. read news
c. neither a nor b
d. both a and b

Correct Answer: D

column1: 6. In Twitter, a message can be ____.
column2:
a. of any size
b. of maximum 100 characters
c. of maximum 140 characters
d. of maximum 200 characters

column1: 7. In Twitter, the relationship between member is based on:
column2:
a. friendship
b. following
c. either a or b
d. both a and b

Correct Answer: B

column1: 8. In Twitter, follower-member is a ____ relationship.
column2:
a. one-to-one.
b. one-to-many
c. many-to-one
d. many-to-many

Correct Answer: C

column1: 9. In Twitter, communication between the sender and the receiver of a tweet is a ____.
column2:
a. one-to-one.
b. one-to-many
c. many-to-one
d. many-to-many

Correct Answer: B

column1: 10. In Twitter, when a message is posted, ____.
column2:
a. all members in the twitter can see it.
b. only followers of the sender can see it.
c. only friends of the sender can see it.
d. none of the above
